description: Curates relevant anonymous intern stories matching user's situation for inspiration and context

stories.situation: Started at ₹10k/month in a Bangalore startup; felt underpaid given workload and skills.
stories.keyLesson: Showcasing practical project work during review can convince startups to pay more.

stories.situation: Unpaid at first; after expressing concerns and readiness to quit, offered ₹15k stipend.
stories.keyLesson: Clear communication about your value and alternatives can drive positive negotiation.

stories.situation: Initially offered ₹20k, used a competing offer to raise stipend to ₹35k/month.
stories.keyLesson: Having another offer greatly strengthens your position in negotiations.

stories.situation: Offered ₹8k for 40+ hours/week, attempts to negotiate met with vague promises.
stories.keyLesson: If promises remain vague, consider searching for better opportunities.

stories.situation: Promised ₹25k but paid only ₹10k after joining; took legal action.
stories.keyLesson: Get stipend details in writing; don’t hesitate to escalate if agreements are violated.

matchingCriteria: City: Bangalore or other major tech hubs
summary.inspirationMessage: Many software interns in startups felt underpaid but succeeded by highlighting their impact, showing competing offers, or standing firm on their value. Persistence and preparation can lead to fairer compensation—don’t hesitate to negotiate!
